title: Easy Steps to Turn Off Your Camera on a Messenger Video Call

steps.title: Tap on .
steps.content: Tap on . You'll see this icon at the bottom of your phone's screen. You might need to tap the screen first to see the options. Your camera should now be disabled. [1] X Research source Using this method, you can have your camera off but still see everyone else in the call. The video camera icon is located at the bottom of the screen if you are using a desktop computer. Tap or click the same video camera icon as before to turn your camera back on!

steps.title: Tap the double-arrow icon to switch between your front and back cameras.
steps.content: Tap the double-arrow icon to switch between your front and back cameras. It looks like two arrows in a circular pattern inside a camera icon at the bottom of your screen. It's to the left of the red button you press to end the call.

steps.title: Update Messenger.
steps.content: Update Messenger. If you're using the desktop or mobile app, you may have an outdated version that won't allow video calls or certain features within video calls. Updating the Messenger app could fix the problem.

steps.title: Check your internet connection.
steps.content: Check your internet connection. Messenger video calls can prematurely end or stutter if your internet connection is poor or if you're constantly switching between data and Wi-Fi or Wi-Fi and data.

steps.title: Video calling isn't available in your area.
steps.content: Video calling isn't available in your area. If you can't video call a specific person, this might be the reason.
